intro: Vismia cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne vismia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and the Guianas. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. Vismia cayennensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
